attributes.action: Stop the use of the Professional Skills tests (Qualified Teacher Status QTS)
attributes.background: My daughter has ADHD. She's been offered a degree with QTS but failed the tests twice. The format causes sensory issues for her. Why is she not competent when she passed her GCSEs with an AB&C in 2014? Why are we allowing discriminating tests to lose passionate teachers of our future generations?
attributes.additional_details:
All prospective trainee teachers must pass the skills tests before they can be recommended for the award of qualified teacher status (QTS). It consists of two exams, some questions are written and presented in a series of on-screen questions, others are audio with headphones. 
Surely we should be ensuring we train the right people and not place a barrier in their way that appears to be meaningless and provides no evidence to support it has any impact on the selection process?

While these characteristics are protected, the fact that a disproportionate amount of sex workers belong to vulnerable groups means that they are still indirectly disadvantaged in the workplace.

For more info on sex work in the UK: http://prostitutescollective.net/

The Equality Act and discrimination:

Cannabis has often been branded as bad for one's health, when in reality, it often soothes anxiety; prevents glaucoma; and doesn't have a harmful effect on your organs like tobacco & alcohol can.

attributes.action: Create a cross Party committee to ensure a positive, inclusive exit from the EU
attributes.background: Many UK citizens fear that the EU exit will lead to a divided nation, governed by fear, hatred towards migrants, and a reduction in the investment in our public services. We need a moderate and progressive cross Party commitment to unity and hope. We want a urgent commitment to collaboration.
attributes.additional_details: With 48.1% of the UK population voting to remain in the EU this morning many of us have woken up to the shocking news that we are to leave the EU. We need to work together to ensure we build a positive outcome for everyone in the UK, and ensure that all Parties work collaboratively. The Government should urgently commit to a cross Party committee to oversee the implementation plan for the exit of the EU.

attributes.action: We call for legislation to regulate the use of referendums by future governments
attributes.background:
We believe that the use of referendums should be avoided, as they undermine the process of representative government on which our parliamentary system depends.

We therefore call upon the Government to introduce to Parliament legislation to create a UK Referendums Act  to regulate their use.
attributes.additional_details:
The Act should include:
•	Criteria for the subjects of referendums – e.g., in questions of national sovereignty; also specific exclusions e.g., questions of conscience such as abortion and assisted suicide
•	Mandatory intervals between referendums on the same subject (e.g., 30 years)
•	A specified required level of support in the Commons for referendums (e.g.,  two-thirds of MPs)
•	A codified assumption that if a referendum fails, the status quo is endorsed 
•	Provisions to ensure that referendum outcomes are endorsed by a majority in the electorate (e.g., by “double majorities” or two-thirds support as for constitutional questions in the USA.)
•	A ban on simplistic questions which can be answered with Yes or No.

attributes.action: End unlawful detention without trial for political opponents in Bangladesh
attributes.background: Since 2009 the Bangladesh government have been purging members of opposition parties, in particular the Bangladesh National Party (BNP).  In August 2016 Hummam Chowdhury and Mir Ahmad Bin Quasem with links to the BNP, were picked arrested and continue to be unlawfully detained without trial.
attributes.additional_details: We call on the UK government to put diplomatic pressure on the Bangladesh government and Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to immediately end the detention of political opponents of the Awami League Party and release Mr Chowdhury and Mr Bin Quasem.  The UK government should do everything it can to prevent further human rights abuses in Bangladesh and should consider pressing for sanctions with the international community if this practice persists.

attributes.action: Make the placing and/or using of all snare traps illegal.
attributes.background: The frantic struggles of the trapped animal cause the snare wire to knot so that it tightens and the animal dies of strangulation. This barbaric practice not only traps & kills foxes, which it is designed for, it also kills other wildlife (badgers, otters) & peoples pets too.
attributes.additional_details:
Snare trapping involves setting a stiff but flexible steel wire in the shape of a crude noose on an animal trail. The wire is staked in the ground or attached to fence posts. A (legal) free-running snare is supposed to slacken when the animal stops struggling, however a rusted, kinked or knotted snare effectively becomes self-locking.

If any snares remain legal, then it is harder to enforce the law against illegal snares or against illegal use of legal snares.

attributes.action: Stronger penalties for bullying, harassment and hate crime in the workplace.
attributes.background:
All of the above costs the UK economy loss of monies. It adversely impacts on the victim's career, physical and mental health and personal life. 

As per NHS choices one of the causes of suicide is bullying.
attributes.additional_details: The victim's voice is often lost. There is a general disbelief and isolation when the victim raises concerns through in house grievance processes. It is " institutional failure " when the victim is treated with a lack of humanity and lack of dignity at work. Hence, the victim needs to be supported through the government, parliament and petition. It benefits the UK economy and the victim both.

attributes.action: Fund adrenaline auto-injectors and training for life-threatening asthma attacks
attributes.background: Out of hospital asthma attacks kill 800 per year. News reports attest to the helplessness of parents and bystanders. At autopsy lungs are blocked with mucus plugs. Intramuscular adrenaline opens airways, reduces mucus, allows cough, and on arrival paramedics give it as part of severe asthma guidance
attributes.additional_details: President Obama's 2013 bill allowed adrenaline auto-injector use and training in schools for acute asthma and anaphylaxis with a Good Samaritan proviso. National Review of Asthma Deaths NRAD 2014 said "consider auto injectors if a patient had a previous life-threat attack or near fatal episode", which is no help in first time attacks. EpiPen, Jext, and Emerade needles pass through clothing injecting drug into thigh muscle; 2 or 3 injections may be needed. Ref. doi:10.1136/thoraxjnl-2015-207207

the level of betting advertising is growing out of control.
Its everywhere;
TV adverts
Programme sponsorship
TV channel sponsorship
Sports event sponsors

Most offer free bets, or free money bets as incentives.

Gambling is addictive and destroys family life.

The way in which betting companies advertise need strict control, to curb the ever increasing problem of gambling addiction.
The massive increase in the number of online betting sites being able to fund such promotional activity is testimony to their success at the expense of UK households.

attributes.action: Make leaving an infant alone in a car unsupervised a criminal offence.

I beleive it should be  for the child's welfare.

The hunts are subsidized by the dolphin captivity industry,for a few "show quality' dolphins that are ripped from their families.

The world is watching and speaking out against Taiji but Governments continue to ignore their people. We ask, when will someone in power step forward and end this horrific act before its too late.

attributes.action: Introduce a "Trading Standards" body for politicians

A member of the public providing misleading sales information would be subjected to fines/imprisonment. We want politicians to be subject to the same rules.
attributes.additional_details: We want an independent body to hold politicians to account.  This body should have the power to impose personal sanctions for misleading statements. These sanctions should be unlimited fines and imprisonment as can currently be imposed by Trading Standards on members of the public.  The punishment should reflect the scale and impact of the misleading statement.

Equality movements started being effective in the 1960's, yet we haven't seen modern equality spread to school uniform policy. 
Nobody should be expected to dress a certain way purely because of the way they were born. 
This would also help fight abuse towards transgender schoolchildren.

attributes.action: Call for a UK referendum on the abolition of the "unelected" UK monarchy.

One of the many arguments for the case of the UK leaving was to disconnect ourselves from the influence of unelected officials making choices on our behalf. So why stop with the EU? Let us now have a referendum on the relevance of the monarchy in our new modern UK.

attributes.action: Ban the giving of goldfish as prizes at fairgrounds in the UK.

attributes.additional_details: Goldfish have a long life span, require a large volume of water to swim around in and also consume a large amount of oxygen. These fish grow to a large size when fully grown (around 36cm) and also produce a lot of waste compared to many other species available in the aquarium trade. It is universally accepted that one common goldfish needs at least 70 litres on its own with a bigger tank always being better and goldfish as prizes only adds to the problem of people thinking they are expendable.

attributes.action: Introduce a new written UK Constitution

We need a set of ground rules that we understand and which respect our fundamental rights and freedoms in matters of employment law, property, housing, healthcare, education, children and access to courts. attributes.action: Abolish the pay to stay proposals in the current housing bill.
attributes.background: The pay to stay policy is part of the current Housing Bill that is going through parliament. attributes.additional_details: There are several articles circulating with people's stories and how it will affect them. I believe the threshold is far too low, as a family earning £3/40,000 a year would not be able to buy a home on this income. Moreover, there are no controls on the current market so prices are ridiculously high. Families will split to avoid exceeding the threshold or the stress/strain of paying 150% more in rent. attributes.action: Change the law to require all bus companies to offer free travel for children

This would reduce congestion & pollution as parents would encourage children to use buses.

attributes.action: Parliament must approve the PM's plan for Brexit before Article 50 is invoked.

MPs should consider whether the Government’s plan is realistic, achievable, adequately manages risk and benefits all the people of Britain. MPs have a duty to ensure high quality planning.
attributes.additional_details: The Chilcot report describes the failures of government planning and inadequate Parliamentary scrutiny that led to the disastrous intervention in Iraq. Should Article 50 be invoked, without a plan scrutinised by parliament, as some propose, we could see a future enquiry coming to similar conclusions about Brexit.

attributes.action: UK Government to stop using the term 'Islamic State' & refer to them as 'Daesh'.

attributes.additional_details: I am a Muslim living in the UK. attributes.action: Make politicians accountable for being Clear, Fair and Not misleading.
attributes.background: The ‘clear, fair and not misleading’ requirement is used in financial services, where companies are accountable for the statements they make about their products to customers. Statements made by politicians may influence the entire country - and should at least meet this same threshold.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is in response to the misrepresentations, mistruths and lies that the electorate were fed by politicians in the EU referendum. 

Immediate admissions have been made that information in the campaigns was misleading (such as Farage stating that the £350m NHS claim was a ‘mistake’ / and Liam Fox confirming that the correct number is ‘a net £10bln’ or ‘more like £160m’, etc.) 

The UK electorate has a right to expect politicians to be clear, fair and not misleading in all statements.

attributes.action: Introduce stronger laws on anti-Islamism.
attributes.background: Muslims in Britain are facing increased hostility, prejudice and discrimination. Stop the negative portrayal of a whole religion and terming 'terrorism' with Islam in the media. Ordinary Muslims do not need to suffer for the actions of a minority.
attributes.additional_details: In the light of recent terrorist attacks; including the Paris and Orlando shootings, the whole religion of Islam has been constantly blamed in the media for the actions of criminals. There is nothing Islamic about committing any forms of abuses. Help stop bigotry in all the media and our institutions so that ordinary Muslims can live normal lives in Britain.

attributes.action: Spread awareness about Mental Health. It's a bigger killer than cancer.
attributes.background: 1in4 people in the UK suffer from Mental Health. There's a stigma attached which needs to be banished so people can easily and proudly seek the help needed. Campaigns need to be set up such as tv/radio adverts like you see/hear daily about other illnesses as this ones the biggest killer.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information on facts/figures, where to seek help and advice follow the link below to my post. 
Together we need to beat the stigma and make the UK realise this is something that should be talked about daily. In schools, in the workplace etc. Due to the stigma people are not getting the help needed and funds are being cut to do with mental health. 
It is not anything to be ashamed of, its an illness.
http://turquoisetrouble.blogspot.co.uk/2016/05/mental-health-awareness-listen-love.html

attributes.action: Fund the NHS more money so that ambulance response times improve
attributes.background: Ambulances take a long time to get to people. My Grandfather broke his leg and the ambulance didn't get to him till an hour after being called. If the ambulance had responded sooner then his pain would've been relieved quicker. Give more money to the NHS and stuff like this would be prevented
